title: 661-B
statement: B. Seasonstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test64 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given a name of a month. Output the season of the year to which it belongs (based on Northern hemisphere).InputThe input consists of a single string containing the name of one of the twelve months (January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November or December). The string is capitalized as given here.OutputOutput a single string â€” the season of the year to which the given month belongs (winter, spring, summer or autumn). The name of the season should be in lowercase.ExamplesInputAprilOutputspringInputNovemberOutputautumnNoteAssume that winter is December through February, spring is March through May, summer is June through August and autumn is September through November.

processed.result:
You are given the name of a month.  Determine and output the season of the year that month belongs to (based on the Northern Hemisphere).

Here are the season definitions:

* Winter: December, January, February
* Spring: March, April, May
* Summer: June, July, August
* Autumn: September, October, November 


For example:

* Input: April
* Output: spring

* Input: November
* Output: autumn
Given a month of the year, determine and output the season it belongs to (winter, spring, summer, or autumn) based on the Northern Hemisphere.
